Dreyfus, Lee S., and Wallace M. Bradley (eds.) Televised Instruction:
A Series of Lectures from Wayne-RCA Invitational Conference on
Televised Instruction, June 19-22, 1961. Michigan: Mass
Communications Center, Wayne State University, Detroit.
Sixteen lectures by prominent educators and educational
television broadcasters in the areas of technology, research,
and production.
Educational Facilities Laboratory, Inc. Design for ETV: Planning
for Schools with Television. New York: 477 Madison Avenue,
1960.
Illustrated book showing the possibilities for improving
learning by improving the environment in which it takes
place and by adapting school buildings to new teaching
methods and concepts.
Greenhill, Leslie P. Closed-Circuit Television for Teaching in
Colleges and Universities. University Park, Pennsylvania:
Pennsylvania State University, University Division of
Instructional Services, 1961 and 1963.
Griffith, Barton L. and Donald W. MacLennan. Improvement of
Teaching by Television. Columbia, Missouri: University of
Missouri Press, 1964.
Proceedings of the National Conference of the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters at the University
of Missouri, March 2-4, 1964.
Lewis, Philip L. Educational Television Guidebook. New York:
McGraw-Hill Book Company, 1961.
A non-technical guidebook to systems, equipment and educational
applications of educational television.
